title.narrative: Ho Chi Minh City Green Transport Development

description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve the performance and efficiency of public transport along a high priority corridor in Ho Chi Minh City.

participating-org.narrative: Transport Works Construction Investment Project Management Authority (TCIP) of Ho Chi Minh City

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement: Sections I and II of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement | Description :The Recipient shall maintain theimplementation arrangements and the Project monitoring reporting and evaluation as described respectively in Sections I and II ofSchedule 2 to the Financing Agreement. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Number of studies completed under Component 2 of the project
Percentage of training courses delivered to the HCMC PC and its agencies
Percentage of improvements to station access within a 400-meter radius completed
Percentage of intersections with improved traffic and safety control
Percentage of planned greening and landscaping activities along the corridor completed
Percentage of sidewalk improvements completed along the BRT route
Difference in GHG emissions compared to BAU case
Number of passengers per day using the BRT system
Number of residents accessing Thu Thiem Development within 45 minutes. (Sub-Indicator)
Number of workers and students accessing Thu Thiem Development within 45 minutes
Low income riders satisfied with the service provided by Public Transport (Sub-Indicator)
People satisfied with the service provided by Public Transport
Women satisfied with the service provided by Public Transport (Sub-Indicator)
Travel time by public transport along the project corridor, measured as in-vehicle time from An Lac to Ky Con (14.1 km)
Area of multi-function public space developed under the pilot project, connected with BRT
Number of BRT passengers who use non-motorized vehicles connect to/from BRT stations
Bus route network is re-organized for better connection with the BRT and ready for implementation
Legal framework and operational guide for implementation of TOD urban design are developed and endorsed by relevant authorities
Average floor area ratio (FAR) of the corridor area as defined in the revised detailed zoning plans
